channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Math and Dance: Notes from emerging interaction
item.description: arXiv:2408.10342v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Choreographer Reggie Wilson and mathematician Jesse Wolfson describe interactions of math and dance emerging from their 12+ year engagement with Black movement and music traditions as part of Wilson's research-to-performance/performance-to-research choreographic practice, with examples including fractals, braids and choreographic and mathematical notions of space, time and movement.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Notices of the AMS, vol. 68, 2021, no. 11, pp. 1926-1929
item.dc:creator: Reggie Wilson, Jesse Wolfson

item.title: Fractals in Africanist Music
item.description: arXiv:2408.10400v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We investigate fractal structures in African and African diasporic music, building on hypotheses of choreographer Reggie Wilson and research on fractals in African material culture by Ron Eglash.
item.dc:creator: Claudio G\'omez-Gonz\'ales, Sidhanth Raman, Siddharth Viswanath, Jesse Wolfson
